renewal.hint_text: A renewal is a letting to the same tenant in the same property.

startdate.header: What is the tenancy start date?
startdate.hint_text: The tenancy must start on or after 1 April 2021 to be within the current collection window.

intermediate_rent_product_name.header: What is intermediate rent product name?

tenant_code.hint_text: This is how you usually refer to this tenancy on your own systems.

propcode.hint_text: This is how you usually refer to this property on your own systems.

postcode_known.check_answer_label: Do you know the property postcode?
postcode_known.header: Do you know the property’s postcode?

la_known.check_answer_label: Do you know what local authority the property is located in?
la_known.header: Do you know what local authority the property is located in?

first_time_property_let_as_social_housin.check_answer_label: First time being let as social-housing?
first_time_property_let_as_social_housin.header: Is this the first time the property has been let as social housing?

0.hint: This is a re-let of existing social housing.

unitletas.header: What type was the property most recently let as?

rsnvac.header: What is the reason for the property being vacant?

1.hint: Excluding renewals of a fixed-term tenancy

10.value: Previous tenant died with no succession

2.value: Re-let to tenant who occupied same property as temporary accommodation

3.value: Tenant involved in a succession downsize

5.value: Tenant moved to other social housing provider

4.value: Tenant moved to private sector or other accommodation

9.value: Tenant was evicted due to anti-social behaviour

8.value: Tenant was evicted due to rent arrears

rsnvac.header: What is the reason for the property being vacant?

12.value: First let of conversion, rehabilitation or acquired property

offered.check_answer_label: Times previously offered since becoming available
offered.header: Since becoming available for re-let, how many times has the property been previously offered?
offered.hint_text: If the property is being offered for let for the first time, enter 0.

offered.check_answer_label: Times previously offered since becoming available
offered.header: Since becoming available, how many times has the property been previously offered?
offered.hint_text: If the property is being let for the first time, enter 0.

unittype_gn.header: What type of unit is the property?

builtype.header: What type of building is the property?

1.value: Converted from previous residential or non-residential property

wchair.check_answer_label: Property built or adapted to wheelchair-user standards
wchair.header: Is the property built or adapted to wheelchair-user standards?

beds.header: How many bedrooms does the property have?
beds.hint_text: If shared accommodation, enter the number of bedrooms occupied by this household. A bedsit has 1 bedroom.

property_void_date.header: What is the void or renewal date?

rsnvac: First let of conversion, rehabilitation or acquired property

property_void_date.header: What is the new-build handover date?

majorrepairs.check_answer_label: Major repairs carried out during void period
majorrepairs.header: Were any major repairs carried out during the void period?
majorrepairs.hint_text: Major repairs are works that could not be reasonably carried out with a tenant living at the property. For example, structural repairs.

rsnvac: First let of conversion, rehabilitation or acquired property

startertenancy.check_answer_label: Is this a starter or introductory tenancy?

tenancy.header: What is the type of tenancy?

tenancy.check_answer_label: Type of main tenancy after the starter period has ended?
tenancy.header: What is the type of tenancy after the starter period has ended?
tenancy.hint_text: This is also known as an ‘introductory period’.

tenancylength.header: What is the length of the fixed-term tenancy to the nearest year?

letting_in_sheltered_accommodation.check_answer_label: Is this letting in sheltered accommodation?
letting_in_sheltered_accommodation.header: Is this letting in sheltered accommodation?

household.label: About the household
household.description: Make sure the tenant has seen the Department for Levelling Up, Housing & Communities (DLUHC) privacy notice before completing this section.

sex1.header: Which of these best describes the tenant’s gender identity?

ethnic.header: What is the tenant’s ethnic group?

0.value: White: English, Welsh, Scottish, Northern Irish or British

1.value: UK national returning from residence overseas

ecstat1.header: Which of these best describes the tenant’s working situation?

2.value: In government training into work, such as New Deal

7.value: Unable to work because of long term sick or disability

other_hhmemb.header: How many other people are there in the household?
other_hhmemb.hint_text: The maximum number of others is 7.

relat2.header: What’s person 2’s relationship to lead tenant

1.value: Child - includes young adult and grown-up
1.hint: Must be eligible for child benefit, aged under 16 or under 20 if still in full-time education.

armedforces.header: Does anybody in the household have any links to the UK armed forces?
armedforces.hint_text:
This excludes national service.

If there are several people in the household with links to the UK armed forces, you should answer for the regular. If there’s no regular, answer for the reserve. If there’s no reserve, answer for the spouse or civil partner.
armedforces.check_answer_label: Household links to UK armed forces

0.value: Yes, the person is a current or former regular

1.value: Yes, the person is a current or former reserve

2.value: Yes, the person is a spouse or civil partner of a UK armed forces member and has been bereaved or separated from them within the last 2 years

depends_on.armedforces: Yes, the person is a current or former regular

leftreg.header: Is the person still serving in the UK armed forces?
leftreg.check_answer_label: Person still serving in UK armed forces

1.value: No, they left up to and including 5 years ago

2.value: No, they left more than 5 years ago

depends_on.armedforces: Yes, the person is a current or former regular
Yes, the person is a current or former reserve

reservist.header: Was the person seriously injured or ill as a result of serving in the UK armed forces?
reservist.check_answer_label: Person seriously injured or ill as result of serving in UK armed forces

preg_occ.header: Is anybody in the household pregnant?

accessibility_requirements.header: Does anybody in the household have any disabled access needs?
accessibility_requirements.check_answer_label: Anybody in household with disabled access needs

illness.header: Does anybody in the household have a physical or mental health condition (or other illness) expected to last 12 months or more?
illness.check_answer_label: Anybody in household with physical or mental health condition

condition_effects.header: How is the person affected by their condition or illness?
condition_effects.check_answer_label: How is person affected by condition or illness

illness_type_1.hint: For example, blindness or partial sight.

illness_type_2.hint: For example, deafness or partial hearing.

illness_type_3.hint: For example, walking short distances or climbing stairs.

illness_type_4.hint: For example, lifting and carrying objects or using a keyboard.

illness_type_9.hint: For example, associated with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) which includes Asperger’s or attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).

layear.check_answer_label: Length of time in local authority area
layear.header: How long has the household continuously lived in the local authority area of the new letting?

0.value: Just moved to local authority area

lawaitlist.check_answer_label: Length of time on local authority waiting list
lawaitlist.header: How long has the household been on the local authority waiting list for the new letting?

0.value: Just moved to local authority area

reason.check_answer_label: Reason for leaving last settled home
reason.header: What is the tenant’s main reason for the household leaving their last settled home?
reason.hint_text: The tenant’s ’last settled home’ is their last long-standing home. For tenants who were in temporary accommodation or sleeping rough, their last settled home is where they were living previously.

0.value: End of assured shorthold tenancy - no fault

1.value: End of assured shorthold tenancy - eviction or tenant at fault

2.value: End of fixed term tenancy - no fault

3.value: End of fixed term tenancy - eviction or tenant at fault

4.value: Permanently decanted from another property owned by this landlord

5.value: Left home country as a refugee

7.value: Discharged from long stay hospital or similar institution

9.value: Asked to leave by family or friends

11.value: Death of household member in last settled accommodation

12.value: To move nearer to family, friends or school

19.value: Couldn’t afford fees attached to renewing the tenancy

21.value: Couldn’t afford rent or mortgage - welfare reforms

22.value: Couldn’t afford rent or mortgage - employment

23.value: Couldn’t afford rent or mortgage - other

25.value: Property unsuitable because of ill health or disability

26.value: Property unsuitable because of poor condition

28.value: Under occupation - offered incentive to downsize

29.value: To move to accommodation with support

reason.check_answer_label: Reason for leaving last settled home
reason.header: What is the tenant’s main reason for the household leaving their last settled home?

0.value: End of fixed term tenancy - no fault

1.value: End of assured shorthold tenancy - no fault

prevten.check_answer_label: Where was the household immediately before this letting?
prevten.header: Where was the household immediately before this letting?
prevten.hint_text: This is where the household was the night before they moved.

0.value: Fixed-term local authority general needs tenancy

1.value: Lifetime local authority general needs tenancy

2.value: Fixed-term private registered provider (PRP) general needs tenancy

3.value: Lifetime private registered provider (PRP) general needs tenancy

16.value: Tied housing or rented with job

prevten.check_answer_label: Where was the household immediately before this letting?
prevten.header: Where was the household immediately before this letting?

underoccupation_benefitcap.check_answer_label: Removal of spare room subsidy or benefit cap
underoccupation_benefitcap.header: Was the reason for leaving a direct result of the removal of the spare room subsidy or benefit cap introduced from 2013?

0.value: Yes - removal of the spare room subsidy

homeless.header: Did the household experience homelessness immediately before this letting?

0.value: Assessed as homeless (or threatened with homelessness within 56 days) by a local authority and owed a homelessness duty

1.value: Other homeless - not found statutorily homeless but considered homeless by landlord

previous_postcode_known.header: Do you know the postcode of the household’s last settled accommodation?
previous_postcode_known.hint_text: This is also known as the household’s ’last settled home’.

previous_postcode.check_answer_label: Postcode of household’s last settled accommodation

previous_la_known.check_answer_label: Do you know the local authority of the household’s last settled accommodation?
previous_la_known.header: Do you know the local authority of the household’s last settled accommodation?
previous_la_known.hint_text: This is also known as the household’s ’last settled home’.

prevloc.check_answer_label: Location of household’s last settled accommodation
prevloc.hint_text: Select ‘Northern Ireland’, ‘Scotland’, ‘Wales’ or ‘Outside the UK’ if the household’s last settled home was outside England.

reasonpref.header: Was the household given ‘reasonable preference’ by the local authority?
reasonpref.hint_text: Households may be given ‘reasonable preference’ for social housing, also known as ‘priority need’, by the local authority.

reasonable_preference_reason.header: Why was the household given ‘reasonable preference’?

rp_homeless.value: They were homeless or about to lose their home (within 56 days)

rp_insan_unsat.value: They were living in unsanitary, overcrowded or unsatisfactory housing

rp_medwel.value: They needed to move due to medical and welfare reasons (including disability)

rp_hardship.value: They needed to move to avoid hardship to themselves or others

referral.header: What was the source of referral for this letting?

1.value: Tenant applied directly (no referral or nomination)

2.value: Re-located through official housing mobility scheme

referral.header: What was the source of referral for this letting?

1.value: Tenant applied directly (no referral or nomination)

2.value: Private registered provider (PRP) lettings only - nominated by a local housing authority

3.value: Re-located through official housing mobility scheme

referral.header: What was the source of referral for this letting?

1.value: Tenant applied directly (no referral or nomination)

2.value: Private registered provider (PRP) supported lettings only - referred by local authority housing department

3.value: Re-located through official housing mobility scheme

referral.header: What was the source of referral for this letting?

1.value: Tenant applied directly (no referral or nomination)

2.value: Private registered provider (PRP) lettings only - nominated by a local housing authority

3.value: Private registered provider (PRP) supported lettings only - referred by local authority housing department

4.value: Re-located through official housing mobility scheme

net_income_known.check_answer_label: Do you know the household’s combined income?
net_income_known.header: Do you know the household’s combined income?

earnings.header: How much income does the household have in total?

incfreq.check_answer_label: How often does the household receive this amount?
incfreq.header: How often does the household receive this amount?

hb.header: Is the household likely to be receiving any of these housing-related benefits?

1.value: Universal Credit with housing element (excluding housing benefit)

2.value: Housing benefit and Universal Credit (without housing element)

benefits.check_answer_label: Household income from Universal Credit, state pension or benefits
benefits.header: How much of the household’s income is from Universal Credit, state pensions or benefits?
benefits.hint_text: This excludes child and housing benefit, council tax support and tax credits.

household_charge.check_answer_label: Does the household pay rent or charges?
household_charge.header: Does the household pay rent or other charges for the accommodation?

period.check_answer_label: Frequency of household rent and charges
period.header: How often does the household pay rent and other charges?

is_carehome.header: Is this accommodation a care home?

chcharge.header: How much does the household pay every week?

is_carehome.header: Is this accommodation a care home?

chcharge.header: How much does the household pay every 2 weeks?

is_carehome.header: Is this accommodation a care home?

chcharge.header: How much does the household pay every 4 weeks?

is_carehome.header: Is this accommodation a care home?

chcharge.header: How much does the household pay every month?

brent.hint_text: This is the amount paid before any charges are added for services (for example, hot water or cleaning). Households may receive housing benefit or Universal Credit towards basic rent.

scharge.hint_text: For example, for cleaning. Households may receive housing benefit or Universal Credit towards the service charge.

pscharge.header: What is the personal service charge?
pscharge.hint_text: For example, for heating or hot water. This doesn’t include housing benefit or Universal Credit.

supcharg.hint_text: Any charges made to fund support services included in tenancy agreement.

tcharge.hint_text: This is the total for rent and all charges.

hbrentshortfall.check_answer_label: Outstanding amount for basic rent and charges
hbrentshortfall.header: After the household has received any housing-related benefits, will they still need to pay for rent and charges?

tshortfall.header: What do you expect the outstanding amount to be?
tshortfall.hint_text: Give an estimated amount if you don’t know the exact figure.
